p.k: Legendary Serbian jazz trumpeter, composer, and arranger Dusko Gojkovic takes the lead in this intimate concert at Brussels Jazz Club, in 1980. By the time of this show, Gojkovic had long-established his status as one of Europe's greatest jazz musicians.
p.d: Born in Jajce, Bosnia and Herzegovina in 1931, legendary jazz trumpeter, composer, and arranger Dusko Gojkovic kicked off his career in jazz music when he joined his first professional band, the Radio Big Band of Belgrade, at age 18. After playing with the Frankfurt All-Stars in Germany for several years, he celebrated his international breakthrough thanks to his 1958 performance at the Newport Jazz Festival. Since then, Gojkovic has played alongside dozens of renowned big bands and released over 30 leading albums and EPs. In this performance, he enchants an intimate audience with his exceptional musicianship at Brussels Jazz Club in Belgium, in early 1980.
